bunpro.meaning: To be (Honorific), To come (Honorific), To go (Honorific)
bunpro.meaning_warning: Remember not to use honorific language when speaking about yourself and your actions!
bunpro.writeup: いらっしゃるis another of the commonhonorific languageexpressions in Japanese. This means that it elevates the status of another person, in order to pay them respect. It will never be used when referring to the speaker themselves, or their own actions.いらっしゃるcan be used to replace居る'to be',来る'to come', or行く 'to go'. This is due to the unique perspective thathonorific languageplaces the speaker in, in relation to the person that is being respected. This is a slightly advanced concept that we will discuss more later.To useいらっしゃる, simply replaceいる,くる, or いく withいらっしゃる.Alternatively,いらっしゃるmay also be used to replaceいる,くる, or いく when they are attached to theて-formof another verb.Fun Factおいでになる is another expression which can replaceいる,くる, or いく. This was briefly examined previously in ourお〜になるgrammar point. おいでになる andいらっしゃるare almost completely interchangable.

examples.japanese: あなたの隣にいらっしゃるのはお嫁さんですか。
examples.english: Is the person (existing) next to you your wife?

examples.japanese: あと30分で社長がいらっしゃるので準備をしてください。
examples.english: The CEO is coming in 30 minutes, so please get ready.

examples.japanese: 先輩は明日の忘年会にはいらっしゃいますか?
examples.english: Senpai, are you coming to the end-of-year party tomorrow?

examples.japanese: 田中様が来ていらっしゃったので案内をお願いします。
examples.english: Mr. Tanaka is here, so please see to his needs.

examples.japanese: マユミさんはタクシーに乗っていらっしゃるのでもうすぐ着きます。
examples.english: Mayumi-san is coming by taxi, so she will be here soon.

examples.japanese: 今日は歩いていらっしゃいそうです。
examples.english: It appears as though he will come by foot.

examples.japanese: 社長は忘年会においでになると聞きました。
examples.english: I heard that the CEO will be at the end of year party.

examples.japanese: 社長は忘年会にいらっしゃると聞きました。
examples.english: I heard that the CEO will be at the end of year party.

examples.japanese: 分からない人はいらっしゃいますか。
examples.english: Is there anyone who doesn't understand?

examples.japanese: お客さんがいらっしゃいました。
先にいらっしゃったんですが。
今、西畑先生はいらっしゃいますか。

false_friends.meaning: To be, There is,  To remain (in a state)
To go to, To head toward
